thread.title: Sydney FC demand apology over obscene banner
thread.title_full: Sydney FC demand apology over obscene banner

title: Sydney FC demand apology over obscene banner
text:
Sydney FC demand official apology for Graham Arnold from Wanderers over sex act banner at derby  24pm by Tom Smithies Source: The Daily Telegraph THE homophobic banner that sparked a storm at the Sydney derby on Saturday night has threatened to strain the relationship between the city’s two A-League clubs, with Sydney FC seeking a public apology from the Wanderers on behalf of coach Graham Arnold. 
After the Wanderers’ active fans in the Red and Black Bloc unfurled a moving banner depicting a blue male face — clearly meant to be Arnold — engaged in oral sex during the game, in front of a crowd of more than 42,000, a significant backlash has arisen over it, with A-League chiefs meeting on Monday afternoon to address it. Members of the RBB unfurled the offensive banner during Saturday’s Sydney derby. Source: Supplied 
It’s understood that Sydney FC have told Football Federation Australia that they believe the banner was targeted at Arnold, and that he deserves a formal apology from Western Sydney. Arnold is known to be furious at the banner, which was apparently produced to mark the Wanderers’ first win over the Sky Blues in more than three years. 
The storm is likely to cost Western Sydney significantly, with A-League bosses believed to be considering a significant fine for such an explicit and public display. The match was bad tempered on the pitch as WSW ended Sydney’s unbeaten run. Source: News Corp Australia 
The game was also marred by scuffles between supporters inside the stadium and out, with police making some 15 arrests. 
A Wanderers spokesman declined to comment, with club officials meeting on Monday afternoon to review the game and its fallout. Sign up for Sportsmail
